SEARCH
Package main.java.controllers

Class StaffAuthenticationController

java.lang.Object
main.java.controllers.StaffAuthenticationController
public class StaffAuthenticationController extends Object
The StaffAuthenticationController class provides methods for authenticating staff members. It allows staff members to authenticate their username and password, as well as update their password. This class interacts with the StaffDAO to retrieve and update staff information. This class is part of a three-layer architecture, serving as the intermediary between the presentation layer (UI) and the data access layer (DAO).
Since:
24-Apr-2024
Version:
1.3
Author:
SDDA Team 1

  • Method Details

    • authenticateUsername

      public boolean authenticateUsername(String username)
      Authenticates the provided username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to authenticate
      Returns:
      true if the username exists in the system, false otherwise

    • authenticatePassword

      public boolean authenticatePassword(String username, String password)
      Authenticates the provided username and password combination.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to authenticate
      password - the password to authenticate
      Returns:
      true if the username and password match a staff member in the system, false otherwise

    • updatePassword

      public boolean updatePassword(String username, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Updates the password for the specified username if the old password matches.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for which to update the password
      oldPassword - the old password to verify
      newPassword - the new password to set
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully updated, false otherwise

    • checkRole

      public boolean checkRole(String username, StaffRole role)
      Checks if the staff member with the provided username has the specified role.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the staff member to check
      role - the role to check against
      Returns:
      true if the staff member exists and has the specified role, false otherwise
